channel.title: Solder on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Solder on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: How's Your Soldering Technique?
item.description: Today in Tedium: A lot of people use electronics with little to no idea of what actually happens inside of the little box they have on their desk or in their pockets. Sure, we might talk about the chips inside of that machine, or the processing power, but rarely do we think about the connective tissue holding many of the circuits onto the silicon. That tissue is solder, the meltable filler metal that has existed in one form or another for more than 4,000 yearsâ€”long before electronics even existed as a modern context.
